The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, often in rocky or sandy soils. Its leaves are usually narrow and linear, with a rough texture, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Mentzelia angurate is often found in desert scrub and grassland habitats.
